channel.title: How can I activate Windows 7 Build 7000?

item.title: How can I activate Windows 7 Build 7000?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

OK, i got Daemon Tools for that.

But… what’s partition mean in this context? :|[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 15-08-2009, 18:48:20[/size][hr]That was a nooby question. ^^

I’ve googled it now anyways.
Thanks.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 16-08-2009, 23:40:04[/size][hr]Woh, installed it today, took about 5 hours, looks awesome.
Thanks guys.

And uh, is there a reason why somehow it’s freed up 4gb of my hard drive?
I had 16gb, now i got 20gb.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I activate Windows 7 Build 7000?

item.title: How can I activate Windows 7 Build 7000?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I did just like fat_cookies did.

Partition your hard drive. Download Windows 7, I have Build 7100, then get a program like powerISO. Mount the file to a virtual disc using powerISO. Proceed to install Win7.

You absoulutly do not need to back anything up, unless you think you are going to fuck up.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I activate Windows 7 Build 7000?

item.title: How can I activate Windows 7 Build 7000?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

SilentCJ, all you need to do is partition your hard drive. If you currently have 2 or 3 partitions, move all the stuff on one onto your current Windows one (So you have an empty partition). Torrent Partition Magic to Partition your hard disk if needed.
Then on the setup, select the “Advanced” or “Custom” Option and select the empty partition. The setup will install Windows onto this Partition.

Just to let you know, you dont even need to burn the ISO, you can just use a image mounting program like Alcohol, Power ISO or Magic Disc within Windows. (Thats how I installed it on a computer without a cd drive)

Read full topic

item.title: How can I activate Windows 7 Build 7000?
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:7, topic:295234”][quote author=Zillionair1 link=topic=390345.msg2914071#msg2914071 date=1250290660]
Is the file just space reserved for the ISO when it is 100% downloaded?
[/quote]

That’s a good way of putting it yeah.

Another way you could describe it, a water tank takes up a certain amount of square centimetres, it slowly fills up with water, when it is filled, it will be 100%, but yet, the space taken up by the container remains the same.

Or something like that. ;p[/quote]
What?

Read full topic

I don’t have nowhere to back it up to, since my main computer recently died.

Do you reckon it’s really necessary to back up?
